newcomers.title: Newcomers
newcomers.introduction: So you've heard about Databayt and you're curious. Maybe someone invited you to contribute, or you stumbled across our project and want to understand what we're all about. Either way,
newcomers.introDescription: This page is specifically for you - the newcomer who has questions, concerns, and wants to understand how this all works before diving in.

whyDatabayt.title: Why Databayt
whyDatabayt.description: Databayt is a collaborative open-source ecosystem designed to accelerate development. With a patterned, searchable code library, developers can start projects up to 70% completeâ€”never from scratch. While open source has come a long way and countless codebases already exist, there's still real value in building a well-structured, indexed library where code follows consistent patterns and architecture. Databayt is about creating that shared standardâ€”together. It's not just practical; it's exciting to shape a clean, reusable codebase as a communityâ€”making development faster for everyone, and driving collective progress for Databayt as a publicly traded entity.

generateRevenue.title: Generate Revenue
generateRevenue.description: Build once, earn repeatedly through our transparent revenue-sharing model.

realWorldExperience.title: Real-World Experience
realWorldExperience.description: Work on live, enterprise-grade projects solving actual business challenges.

publicOwnership.title: Public Ownership
publicOwnership.description: Own and showcase your work while building a strong GitHub portfolio.

collaborativeLearning.title: Collaborative Learning
collaborativeLearning.description: Learn from experts while working on enterprise solutions with our team.

remoteWork.title: Remote Work
remoteWork.description: There's no office, no required meetings, no fixed hours. Contributors work from their home offices in different countries, coffee shops while traveling, co-working spaces, or wherever they're most productive. You collaborate through GitHub, communicate async, and work on your own schedule.

revenueSharing.title: Revenue Sharing
revenueSharing.description1: No traditional salaries here. Databayt is collectively owned by us - the contributors. When sales team brings in projects, we complete them together and everyone takes their share. You're not an employee; you're a co-owner building equity in something bigger.
revenueSharing.description2: We use a transparent revenue-sharing model where contributors earn a percentage of revenue generated from their contributions across our four core business models.

partTimeContribution.title: Part-Time Contribution
partTimeContribution.description: Perfect for part-time contributors. Most of our successful contributors:
partTimeContribution.breaks: Take breaks when life gets busy
partTimeContribution.success: Many successful contributors started with just 2-3 hours per week.

experienceRequirements.title: Experience Requirements
experienceRequirements.description: Everyone starts somewhere. What matters most:
experienceRequirements.mentorship: We provide mentorship and have "good first issue" labels specifically for newcomers.

explore.title: Explore
explore.description: Browse our GitHub repositories to understand our architecture. Check issues labeled "good first issue" for beginner tasks. Read our documentation to learn our development practices.

setup.title: Setup
setup.description: Pick a repository that matches your skills and interests. Follow our setup guide to configure your environment. Test the development server and start experimenting.

contribute.title: Contribute
contribute.description: Start with small, manageable tasks to build confidence. Follow our contribution guidelines and coding standards. Get feedback from experienced contributors through PRs.

build.title: Build
build.description: Leverage our battle-tested components for your projects. Start with up to 70% of your project pre-built. Customize and extend components to match your needs.

usingComponents.question: Can I use Databayt components in my own projects?
usingComponents.answer: Yes! All components are open source and can be used in your projects according to their respective licenses. We encourage reuse and building upon our work.

experience.question: What if I'm not experienced enough?
experience.answer: We have contributors at all skill levels. Beginners often bring fresh perspectives that experts miss. We provide mentorship and support.

workOn.question: How do I know what to work on?
workOn.answer: Start with issues labeled "good first issue", join community discussions, or talk to project maintainers. You're never working blindly.

futureOpportunities.title: Future Opportunities
futureOpportunities.intro: As you grow with us, you can look forward to:
futureOpportunities.designSystem: Contributing to our design system framework
futureOpportunities.education: Helping create our developer education platform

readyToStart.title: Ready to Start?
readyToStart.description: Every contributor started exactly where you are now. You don't have to decide everything today. Just take one small step forward.

joinDiscord.label: Join Discord:
joinDiscord.link: Connect with our community on Discord

introduction.title: Introduction
introduction.boring: the boring. at Databayt we're building codebase for business automation, one atomic component at a time. Every line of code is open source, every contribution is valued, and every developer may shape the future of how businesses operate.
introduction.sellTime1: We sell the origin of all value â€” we sell
introduction.sellTime2: the currency that drives the world â€” what if you could reclaim yours and focus on what truly matters? It's more than a service â€” it's an escape from the matrix. A restoration of time through the elimination of repetitive tasks, streamlined operations, and automated processes. Break free. Reclaim your hours.
introduction.repository2: Think of our codebase as a living library where every contribution becomes part of something greater. From atomic components to complete templates, from blocks to micro-services to full automation solutionsâ€”we're creating the building blocks that will power tomorrow's businesses.
introduction.followAlong2: this out together. This isn't just about building software; it's about creating a collaborative ecosystem where developers, businesses, and innovators unite to solve real problems. Every contribution you make doesn't just help one projectâ€”it becomes part of a growing foundation that serves countless businesses worldwide.

perProject.title: Per Project
perProject.description: Custom solutions tailored to specific client requirements and business processes. Each project delivers unique automation systems designed to solve particular challenges and operational needs.

partners.title: Partners
partners.description: Partnership opportunities for businesses seeking to outsource technology development, access specialized talent for temporary projects and specific technical expertise.

codebase.title: Codebase
codebase.description: Codebase executes the majority of the task, through accumulated, reusable components. Contributors who expand this foundation earn a share of the value it generates.

saas.title: SaaS
saas.description: Ready-to-deploy software products sold to multiple organizations with similar needs. act as a go-to central hub for businesses seeking automation solutions.

transparency.title: Transparency
transparency.description: Every decision, from technical architecture to business strategy, is documented and accessible to the community. We use GitHub to manage our codebase and discussions, ensuring transparency, traceability, and open collaboration. Contributions are publicly tracked, so every developer can see their impact and know the process is clear and fair. We believe this openness builds trust and enables better contributions.

innovation.title: Innovation
innovation.description: Our best ideas come from our diverse community of developers, business professionals, and users. We actively encourage contributions and value every perspective. We're actively building in: Business Automation, Data Analytics, AI Agents, Blockchain, and Distributed Computing.

growth.title: Growth
growth.description: We balance rapid innovation with long-term sustainability, ensuring our solutions remain robust and our business model benefits all stakeholders.

excellence.title: Excellence
excellence.description: Every product we ship meets the highest standards of quality, security, and performance. Our reputation is built on reliable, enterprise-grade solutions.

forDevelopers.title: For Developers
forDevelopers.contributeDesc: How to get involved in development

forStakeholders.title: For Stakeholders
forStakeholders.roadmapDesc: Product development plans and strategic goals

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.newComer: New comer? Start with the essentials:

businessModel.title: Business Model
businessModel.description: Databayt operates through four complementary revenue models that support both sustainability and community-driven growth.

perProject.title: Per Project
perProject.subtitle: Bespoke Development for Unique Business Needs
perProject.description: We deliver custom-built automation systems tailored to the specific operational requirements of individual clients.
perProject.point1: Ideal for companies with complex or specialized workflows
perProject.point2: Involves discovery, architecture, design, and implementation phases
perProject.point3: Generates revenue through direct service contracts
perProject.point4: Often integrates components from our codebase to reduce time-to-delivery

partners.title: Partners
partners.subtitle: Strategic Collaborations & Outsourced Development
partners.description: We form long-term partnerships with businesses that need recurring access to development capacity and domain-specific technical talent.
partners.point1: Perfect for agencies, enterprises, or startups without an in-house tech team
partners.point2: Offers flexible engagement models: staff augmentation, dedicated teams, or project-based collaborations
partners.point3: Revenue comes from retainers, joint ventures, or shared-value agreements
partners.point4: Partners also benefit from priority access to our open-source tools and components

codebase.title: Codebase
codebase.subtitle: Reusable Components as a Revenue Engine
codebase.description: The Databayt codebase is the backbone of our operation: a growing library of clean, modular components contributed by the community.
codebase.point1: These components are used across client projects and SaaS products
codebase.point2: Contributors earn recognition and a share of the value their code generates
codebase.point3: Monetization occurs when projects leverage these prebuilt modules to accelerate delivery
codebase.point4: Encourages collective ownership and open-source sustainability

saas.title: SaaS
saas.subtitle: Scalable Automation Products for Common Needs
saas.description: We package recurring patterns into ready-to-deploy SaaS tools aimed at industries with similar operational challenges.
saas.point1: Examples: CRMs for clinics, document workflow tools for HR, or compliance dashboards for real estate
saas.point2: Allows clients to onboard instantly with minimal configuration
saas.point3: SaaS offerings are continuously improved through usage data and community feedback
saas.point4: This model generates recurring revenue and positions Databayt as a central hub for automation solutions

architecture.title: Architecture
architecture.intro1: the boring. Architecture embodies the same principles we apply to business automation â€” minimal complexity, maximum efficiency, and atomic reusability. Every component is designed to work independently while contributing to a cohesive ecosystem.
architecture.intro2: We don't just build software; we craft
architecture.intro3: that scale with your business. From single components to complete platforms, our architecture supports the journey from prototype to production.

component.title: Component-First
component.description: Every piece of UI is a reusable, tested component

minimal.title: Minimal Complexity
minimal.description: Simple solutions that compound into powerful systems

opensource.title: Open Source First
opensource.description: Transparency in every line of code

shadcn.title: Shadcn/UI Inspired
shadcn.description: Following proven patterns and naming conventions

nextjs.title: Next.js 15
nextjs.description: App Router with React 19 for cutting-edge performance

typescript.title: TypeScript
typescript.description: Type safety across the entire stack

mdx.title: MDX Integration
mdx.description: Documentation as code with seamless content management

tailwind.title: Tailwind CSS
tailwind.description: Utility-first styling for consistent design systems

documentation.title: Documentation-Driven
documentation.description: Every feature documented, every decision transparent

community.title: Community-Centric
community.description: Built for contributors, maintained by the community

automation.title: Automation-Ready
automation.description: Architecture designed for business process automation

nextjs.title: Next.js 15
nextjs.subtitle: App Router with React 19 Server Components

typescript.title: TypeScript
typescript.subtitle: Full-stack type safety and developer experience

shadcn.title: Shadcn/UI
shadcn.subtitle: Copy-paste components built on Radix UI

ecosystem.title: Project Ecosystem
ecosystem.description: Our architecture spans multiple specialized projects, each serving different aspects of business automation:

features.label: Features
features.value: Documentation system, component library, automation tools

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.description: Ready to build with our architecture? Start here:

revenue.title: Revenue Sharing
revenue.collectivelyOwned: Databayt is collectively owned by us - the contributors. When our sales team brings in projects, we complete them together and everyone takes their share, including sales. You're not an employee; you're a co-owner building equity in something bigger.
revenue.transparentModel: We use a transparent revenue-sharing model where contributors earn a percentage of revenue generated from their contributions across our four core business models:
revenue.businessModelsTitle: Our Business Models & Your Revenue Opportunities

perProject.title: Per Project Revenue
perProject.description: Custom solutions tailored to specific client requirements and business processes. Each project delivers unique automation systems designed to solve particular challenges and operational needs.
perProject.earnings: Direct revenue share based on your contribution to project completion. Whether you build components, integrate systems, or manage client requirements - you earn from the project's success.

partnership.title: Partnership Revenue
partnership.description: Partnership opportunities for businesses seeking to outsource technology development, access specialized talent for temporary projects, and leverage specific technical expertise.
partnership.earnings: Revenue share from partnership contracts you help fulfill. Long-term partnerships create recurring income streams as you become the go-to expert for specific partner needs.

codebase.title: Codebase Revenue
codebase.description: Our codebase executes the majority of tasks through accumulated, reusable components. Contributors who expand this foundation earn a share of the value it generates across all projects that use their components.
codebase.earnings: This is where the 40-70% project acceleration pays off. Every time your indexed components are reused in client projects, you earn. Build once, earn repeatedly. Top codebase contributors receive significant monthly earnings from component reuse alone.

saas.title: SaaS Revenue
saas.description: Ready-to-deploy software products sold to multiple organizations with similar needs. We act as a go-to central hub for businesses seeking automation solutions.
saas.earnings: Ongoing royalties from SaaS products you help build. As these products scale to hundreds or thousands of customers, your revenue share grows proportionally.

whyWorks.title: Why This Model Works
whyWorks.codebaseContributorsShare: Codebase contributors whose components are used get their share
whyWorks.everyoneWins: Everyone wins when we succeed together

timeline.title: Expected Timeline:
timeline.month1to3Description: Learn systems, contribute to projects, start earning initial revenue shares
timeline.month6to12Description: Build reusable components, participate in partnerships, increase your earnings
timeline.year2PlusDescription: Major codebase contributor with SaaS involvement, potential for significant recurring revenue

revenue.conclusion: The more value you create for our collective ecosystem, the more you earn. It's that simple.

cd [repository]

step3.title: 3. Set Up Environment

discord.description: Join our active Discord server with 500+ members. Get real-time help and connect with other contributors.

nextSteps.findNicheDesc: Identify areas that match your interests and skills

essentialReading.title: Essential Reading
essentialReading.revenueDesc: How contributors earn from their work

conclusion.learnByDoing: The best way to learn is by doing. Pick a good first issue and start contributing today. Remember, every expert was once a beginner, and we're here to support your journey every step of the way.

localhost.title: Localhost
localhost.description: A complete step-by-step guide to fork, clone, and run Databayt projects locally on your machine.
localhost.learningSteps: Fork repository â†’ Clone locally â†’ Install dependencies â†’ Run development server â†’ Make your first contribution

step1.title: Step 1: Fork the Project
step1.description: Start by creating your own copy of the repository on GitHub.
step1.navigateRepo: Navigate to the repository you want to contribute to
step1.clickFork: Click the "Fork" button in the top-right corner
step1.imageAlt: Click the Fork button on GitHub repository page

step2.title: Step 2: Create Your Fork
step2.description: Ensure the repository name is available and create your fork.
step2.verifyName: Verify the repository name is available
step2.keepDefaults: Keep the default settings (unless you need to change them)
step2.clickCreate: Click "Create fork" to complete the process
step2.imageAlt: Create fork dialog with repository name and settings

step3.title: Step 3: Open VS Code/Cursor
step3.description: Launch your preferred code editor and prepare to clone the repository.
step3.openWindow: Open a new window in VS Code or Cursor
step3.clickClone: Click on "Clone Repository" or use the Source Control panel
step3.prepareURL: Prepare to paste your repository URL
step3.imageAlt: VS Code or Cursor editor with clone repository option highlighted

step4.title: Step 4: Clone from GitHub
step4.description: Get your forked repository URL and clone it locally.
step4.goToRepo: Go back to your forked repository on GitHub
step4.copyURL: Copy the HTTPS URL to your clipboard
step4.pasteURL: Paste it in your editor's clone dialog
step4.imageAlt: GitHub clone dialog showing HTTPS URL copy button

step5.title: Step 5: Choose Local Directory
step5.description: Select where you want to store the project on your computer.
step5.chooseDir: Choose a directory for your projects (e.g., ~/Documents/projects/)
step5.createFolder: Create a new folder if needed
step5.imageAlt: File explorer showing directory selection for cloning

step6.title: Step 6: Open in Editor
step6.description: Open the cloned project in your code editor.
step6.waitCloning: Wait for the cloning process to complete
step6.projectReady: Your project is now ready for development
step6.imageAlt: Project successfully opened in VS Code or Cursor

step7.title: Step 7: Install Dependencies
step7.description: Use pnpm to install all required dependencies.
step7.imageAlt: Terminal showing pnpm install command running

step8.title: Step 8: Set Up Environment
step8.description: Configure your environment variables for local development.
step8.editEnv: Edit .env.local with your specific values (if needed)

step9.title: Step 9: Start Development Server
step9.description: Launch the development server and see your app running.
step9.waitServer: Wait for the server to start
step9.imageAlt: Terminal showing development server running and localhost URL

step10.title: Step 10: Verify Installation
step10.checkWebsite: Check the website loads properly in your browser
step10.verifyReload: Verify hot reload by making a small change
step10.ensureNoErrors: Ensure no console errors are present
step10.imageAlt: Browser showing the running application at localhost:3000

firstContribution.title: Next Steps: Making Your First Contribution
firstContribution.description: Now that your local environment is set up, you're ready to contribute!

testChanges.title: Test Your Changes
testChanges.commands:
# Build the project
pnpm build

# Run linting
pnpm lint

# Type checking (if available)
pnpm type-check

commitPush.title: Commit and Push
commitPush.commands:
# Stage your changes
git add .

# Commit with conventional format
git commit -m "feat: add new feature description"

# Push to your fork
git push origin feature/your-feature-name

createPR.title: Create a Pull Request
createPR.goToFork: Go to your fork on GitHub

commonIssues.title: Common Issues
commonIssues.portSolution:
# Kill process on port 3000
npx kill-port 3000
# Or use a different port
pnpm dev -- --port 3001
commonIssues.nodeSolution:
# Clean and reinstall
rm -rf node_modules pnpm-lock.yaml
pnpm install
commonIssues.envPrefix: Ensure variables start with NEXT_PUBLIC_ for client-side

communitySupport.title: Community Support
communitySupport.description: Join our Discord server for real-time help and connect with other contributors.

localhost.conclusion: Congratulations! You now have a fully functional local development environment. Start exploring the codebase, pick an issue that interests you, and make your first contribution to Databayt!

github.title: GitHub
github.description: Master GitHub workflows and collaboration patterns for contributing to Databayt projects.

essentialKnowledge.title: Essential knowledge:
essentialKnowledge.content: Repository workflows â†’ Collaboration best practices â†’ Code quality standards â†’ Community resources

workflowEssentials.title: Workflow Essentials
workflowEssentials.description: Learn the core GitHub workflows that power effective collaboration.

repositories.title: Repositories
repositories.description: Learn how to fork, clone, and manage repositories for your contributions.

issues.title: Issues & Pull Requests
issues.description: Understand how to create issues, submit pull requests, and collaborate.

branches.title: Branches
branches.description: Master the art of branching for feature development and bug fixes.

collaboration.title: Collaboration
collaboration.description: Learn GitHub's collaborative features like reviews, discussions, and projects.

repositoryManagement.title: Repository Management:
repositoryManagement.commands:
# Clone a repository
git clone git@github.com:username/repository.git

# Check repository status
git status

# View commit history
git log --oneline

branchManagement.title: Branch Management:
branchManagement.commands:
# Create and switch to new branch
git checkout -b feature/your-feature

# Switch between branches
git checkout main
git checkout feature/your-feature

# List all branches
git branch -a

makingChanges.title: Making Changes:
makingChanges.commands:
# Stage changes
git add .
git add specific-file.txt

# Commit changes
git commit -m "feat: add new feature"

# Push changes
git push origin feature/your-feature

stayingUpdated.title: Staying Updated:
stayingUpdated.commands:
# Fetch latest changes
git fetch origin

# Pull latest changes
git pull origin main

# Merge changes
git merge origin/main

commitFormat.title: Commit Message Format
commitFormat.description: Use conventional commits for consistent history:
commitFormat.types:
feat: A new feature
fix: A bug fix
docs: Documentation changes
style: Formatting changes
refactor: Code changes that neither fix bugs nor add features
perf: Performance improvements
test: Adding or correcting tests
chore: Changes to the build process or auxiliary tools

communityResources.title: Community Resources
communityResources.description: Connect with the Databayt community for support and collaboration.

troubleshooting.title: Troubleshooting
troubleshooting.description: Common issues and solutions for GitHub workflows.

stack.title: Technology Stack
stack.introduction: Databayt is built on a carefully curated technology stack that prioritizes performance, developer experience, and scalability. Our architecture follows modern best practices and leverages industry-leading tools across the full development lifecycle.

nextjs.name: Next.js 15
nextjs.description: Our React-based meta-framework providing server-side rendering, static site generation, and powerful developer tooling. Features App Router, streaming, and built-in optimizations for production-ready applications.

react.name: React 19
react.description: Component-based UI library enabling declarative, efficient user interfaces with concurrent features, server components, and enhanced developer experience.

typescript.name: TypeScript
typescript.description: Strongly-typed JavaScript superset enhancing code reliability, maintainability, and developer productivity through comprehensive static analysis and IDE integration.

tailwind.name: Tailwind CSS
tailwind.description: Utility-first CSS framework enabling rapid, consistent, and maintainable styling with excellent performance characteristics and design system integration.

shadcn.name: shadcn/ui
shadcn.description: High-quality, accessible React components built on Radix UI primitives, providing a solid foundation for consistent user experiences.

planetscale.name: PlanetScale
planetscale.description: Serverless MySQL platform providing branching workflows, horizontal scaling, and zero-downtime schema changes with enterprise-grade reliability.

prisma.name: Prisma
prisma.description: Next-generation ORM offering type-safe database access, intuitive schema management, and powerful query capabilities with excellent TypeScript integration.

vercel.name: Vercel
vercel.description: Frontend cloud platform providing instant deployments, automatic scaling, and edge optimization with seamless Git integration and performance monitoring.

zod.name: Zod
zod.description: TypeScript-first schema validation library ensuring runtime type safety and comprehensive data validation across API boundaries.

hookform.name: React Hook Form
hookform.description: Performant, flexible forms library with minimal re-renders, built-in validation, and excellent developer experience for complex form scenarios.

authjs.name: Auth.js
authjs.description: Comprehensive authentication library providing secure, standards-compliant authentication with support for multiple providers and advanced security features.

claude.name: Claude
claude.description: Advanced AI assistant integrated for intelligent code completion, documentation generation, and development workflow optimization.

cursor.name: Cursor
cursor.description: AI-powered code editor enhancing productivity through intelligent suggestions, code generation, and seamless development workflows.

mcp.name: MCP (Model Context Protocol)
mcp.description: Standardized protocol for AI model integration, enabling sophisticated AI-powered features throughout the development stack.

python.name: Python
python.description: Versatile programming language powering our AI/ML pipelines, data processing, and backend automation with extensive ecosystem support.

rust.name: Rust
rust.description: Systems programming language ensuring memory safety and high performance for critical components requiring zero-cost abstractions.

langgraph.name: LangGraph
langgraph.description: Advanced framework for building stateful, multi-actor AI applications with sophisticated workflow orchestration and agent coordination.

vibecoding.name: Vibe Coding
vibecoding.description: AI-enhanced development methodology focusing on intuitive, flow-state programming with intelligent assistance and context-aware tooling.

figma.name: Figma
figma.description: Collaborative design platform enabling seamless design-to-development workflows, component libraries, and cross-functional team alignment.

stack.conclusion: This technology stack represents our commitment to modern development practices, emphasizing type safety, performance, developer experience, and maintainable architecture patterns that scale with our growth.

introduction.consistency: **Consistency** is the foundation of maintainable code. At Databayt, we follow established patterns that ensure our codebase remains scalable, readable, and collaborative. Every pattern serves a purpose â€” from atomic components to server actions, from naming conventions to file organization.
introduction.atomicDesign: We believe in **atomic design principles** where small, reusable components compose into larger, more complex systems. This isn't just about React components; it's a philosophy that extends to functions, hooks, utilities, and entire application architecture.
introduction.realWorld: The patterns documented here emerge from real-world usage across our [open source repositories](https://github.com/abdout/databayt), tested in production environments, and refined through community feedback. Every decision prioritizes developer experience, type safety, and long-term maintainability.

arrowFunctions.title: Arrow Functions
arrowFunctions.description: Preferred for utilities, event handlers, and inline functions. Excellent for maintaining lexical scope and modern JavaScript patterns.

functionDeclarations.title: Function Declarations
functionDeclarations.description: Used for React components, API route handlers, and exported functions. Better for hoisting and debugging stack traces.

pattern.title: Server Actions Pattern
pattern.description: We use Next.js server actions for form submissions and data mutations, following the "use server" directive pattern:

dataFetching.title: Data Fetching Hierarchy
dataFetching.serverComponents: **Server Components**: Direct database queries for initial data
dataFetching.clientComponents: **Client Components**: React Query/SWR for interactive data

atomicDesign.title: Atomic Design Structure
atomicDesign.example:
components/
â”œâ”€â”€ atom/           # Basic elements (Button, Input, Icon)
â”œâ”€â”€ molecule/       # Simple combinations (SearchBox, FormField)
â”œâ”€â”€ organism/       # Complex components (Header, UserTable)
â”œâ”€â”€ template/       # Page layouts and structures
â””â”€â”€ page/          # Complete page compositions

composition.title: Component Composition Pattern

typeDefinition.title: Type Definition Strategy
typeDefinition.props: **Props**: Inline for simple components, separate interfaces for complex ones
typeDefinition.api: **API Types**: Generated from schema or OpenAPI specs
typeDefinition.utility: **Utility Types**: Leverage TypeScript's built-in utility types
typeDefinition.strict: **Strict Mode**: Always enabled with `strict: true` in tsconfig

adoption.title: Pattern Adoption
adoption.livingGuidelines: These patterns are **living guidelines** that evolve with our codebase. They're documented in our [contributing guide](/docs/contributing) and enforced through ESLint rules, Prettier configuration, and code review processes.
adoption.consistency: When in doubt, prioritize **consistency** over personal preference. Our patterns serve the community, ensuring that any developer can jump into any part of the codebase and immediately understand the structure and conventions.
adoption.battleTested: Every pattern has been battle-tested across multiple projects and reflects real-world usage patterns from our [open source repositories](https://github.com/abdout/databayt). They balance developer experience with maintainability, type safety with flexibility.

list.transparency: Maintain transparency about our inspirations and sources

wantCredit.prompt: Want to be credited? If we've used your work and haven't properly attributed it, please

vibeCoding.title: Vibe Coding
vibeCoding.introduction: Welcome to the **Vibe Coding** documentation. This section covers the modern approach to software development using AI-powered code generation and conversational programming.

whatIs.title: What is Vibe Coding?
whatIs.description: **Vibe Coding** refers to a software development approach where developers use large language models (LLMs) to generate code based on natural language prompts. It's characterized by a more relaxed and conversational style, where developers provide high-level directions and the AI handles the low-level implementation details.

prompts.title: Natural Language Prompts
prompts.description: Describe what you want in plain English

ai.title: AI-Generated Code
ai.description: Let LLMs handle the precise coding details

conversation.title: Conversational Development
conversation.description: Iterate through dialogue with AI assistants

direction.title: High-Level Direction
direction.description: Focus on the "what" rather than the "how"

prototyping.title: Rapid Prototyping
prototyping.description: Quickly generate working code from ideas

promptEng.title: 1. Prompt Engineering
promptEng.intro: Master the art of communicating with AI:
promptEng.specific: Be specific about requirements and constraints
promptEng.context: Provide context about your tech stack and preferences
promptEng.break: Break complex tasks into smaller, manageable prompts

iterative.title: 2. Iterative Refinement
iterative.ask: Ask for specific improvements or modifications

partner.title: 3. AI as a Coding Partner
partner.boilerplate: Use AI for boilerplate code generation
partner.help: Get help with complex algorithms and logic

vibeCoding.footer: Vibe coding represents the future of development - where human creativity meets AI capability. Focus on the big picture and let AI handle the details.

upwork.title: Upwork
upwork.introduction: A guide to establish Databayt as a premium automation specialist on Upwork. Every strategy outlined here is based on real production systems and proven results across multiple industries.
upwork.positioning: We position ourselves not just as developers, but as **time-savers** â€” helping businesses reclaim their most valuable asset through intelligent automation. This guide transforms your existing portfolio into a competitive advantage that commands premium rates.

promptGenerator.title: Prompt Generator
promptGenerator.description: Use this AI prompt template for automated proposal generation:

professionalTitle.title: Professional Title
professionalTitle.text: "Business Automation Expert | React/Next.js Developer | Time-Saving Solutions"

overview.title: Professional Overview (2,000 chars)
overview.content:
AUTOMATE THE BORING, 

Help businesses reclaim their most valuable asset: TIME.

We've built 8+ production automation systems across multiple industries, serving real users and saving thousands of hours annually.

PROVEN INDUSTRY EXPERTISE:
Healthcare Management (HIPAA-compliant) - health-underway.vercel.app
Education Platforms (Student/Parent portals) - ed.databayt.org  
Restaurant POS & Kitchen Management Systems
Real Estate & Property Management Platforms
E-commerce & Inventory Solutions

PRODUCTION IMPACT:
â€¢ Healthcare: 80% reduction in appointment scheduling time
â€¢ Education: 70% decrease in administrative tasks
â€¢ Restaurant: Complete POS automation with real-time kitchen displays
â€¢ Real Estate: Automated tenant management and maintenance tracking
â€¢ 5 GitHub repositories with live production applications

CUTTING-EDGE TECH STACK:
â€¢ Frontend: Next.js 15, React 19, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Framer Motion
â€¢ Backend: Prisma ORM, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, NextAuth, Stripe
â€¢ Architecture: Atomic design, Component libraries, Enterprise security
â€¢ Deployment: Vercel, production-ready with CDN optimization

MY GUARANTEE:
Every solution I build is production-tested. You'll see live demos before we even start talking.

Ready to see automation in action? Check my live systems and let's discuss your specific needs.

Available for consultation calls - I'll show you exactly how I'll automate your biggest time-wasters.

databayt.name: Databayt
databayt.description: Business automation platform with comprehensive documentation architecture, hero sections, landing pages, authentication, technical record patterns, MCP protocols, roadmap templates, pricing strategies, and legal compliance blocks.

codebase.name: Codebase
codebase.description: Component library platform featuring shadcn/ui components, atomic templates, dashboard blocks, authentication forms, payment methods, calendar widgets, navigation patterns, card layouts, and interactive playground sections.

company.name: Company
company.description: Corporate website template with hero sections, service offerings, team displays, testimonials, contact forms, portfolio showcases, pricing tables, and professional landing page components.

school.name: School
school.description: Educational management platform with student registration, attendance tracking, grade management, course scheduling, parent communication, teacher dashboards, exam systems, and collaborative editing features.

health.name: Health
health.description: Healthcare management system featuring appointment scheduling, patient records, medical forms, doctor profiles, treatment room management, prescription handling, telemedicine integration, and health status tracking.

realestate.name: Real Estate
realestate.description: Property platform with listing templates, search filters, property details, agent profiles, virtual tours, mortgage calculators, contact forms, and neighborhood information displays.

publicparty.name: Public Party
publicparty.description: Event management system with booking forms, venue listings, catering options, entertainment packages, guest management, payment processing, and event timeline features.

food.name: Food
food.description: Restaurant management platform featuring menu displays, order processing, delivery tracking, customer reviews, reservation systems, kitchen management, payment integration, and loyalty programs.

commitConvention.title: Commit Convention
commitConvention.description: Before you create a Pull Request, please check whether your commits comply with the commit conventions used in this repository.
commitConvention.followFormat: When you create a commit we kindly ask you to follow the convention `category(scope or module): message` in your commit message while using one of the following categories:

feat.title: feat / feature
feat.description: all changes that introduce completely new code or new features

fix.title: fix
fix.description: changes that fix a bug (ideally you will additionally reference an issue if present)

refactor.title: refactor
refactor.description: any code related change that is not a fix nor a feature

docs.title: docs
docs.description: changing existing or creating new documentation (i.e. README, docs for usage of a lib or cli usage)

build.title: build
build.description: all changes regarding the build of the software, changes to dependencies or the addition of new dependencies

test.title: test
test.description: all changes regarding tests (adding new tests or changing existing ones)

ci.title: ci
ci.description: all changes regarding the configuration of continuous integration (i.e. github actions, ci system)

chore.title: chore
chore.description: all changes to the repository that do not fit into any of the above categories

commitConvention.example: e.g. `feat(components): add new prop to the avatar component`
commitConvention.moreInfo: If you are interested in the detailed specification you can visit https://www.conventionalcommits.org/ or check out the [Angular Commit Message Guidelines](https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/22b96b9/CONTRIBUTING.md#-commit-message-guidelines).

testing.title: Testing
testing.intro: Tests are written using [Vitest](https://vitest.dev). You can run all the tests from the root of the repository.
testing.ensure: Please ensure that the tests are passing when submitting a pull request. If you're adding new features, please include tests.
